verses.verse: "Men, brethren, and fathers listen to my defense which I now make to you."
When they heard him speaking to them in the Hebrew language, they grew even more quiet, then he said,

"I am truly a Jewish man born in Tarsus in Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, taught according to the exact teachings of the Law of our ancestors, and was zealous for God as all of you are today.
"I persecuted this way even to death, chaining and imprisoning both men and women

as the High Priest and the whole council of elders can bear me witness. I also got letters from them to the brethren and left for Damascus to bring those who were there back to Jerusalem chained to be punished.
"Now it happened that as I went on my journey I was getting close to Damascus about noon time. Suddenly a bright light shone from heaven all around me.
"I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, «Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?»
"I answered, «Who are you Lord?' Then he said to me, «I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you are persecuting.»
"Those who were me really did see the light and were afraid, but they didn't understand the voice of him who spoke to me.
"I said, «What shall I do, Lord?» The Lord said to me, Get up and go into Damascus, and there everything that is appointed for you to do will be told to you.»
"Since I couldn't see because of the brightness of that light, I was led by the hand by those who were with me, and I came into Damascus.
"One, Ananias, a devout man according to the law, who has a good testimony from all the Jews who lived there,
came to me, stood there, and said to me, «Brother Saul, receive you sight.» That very hour I saw him.
"He said, «The God of our fathers has chosen you, so that you should know His will, to see the Just One, and that you should hear the voice of his mouth.
«For you will be his witness to all people of what you have seen and heard.
«Now what are you waiting for? Get up, be baptized, wash away your sin, calling on the name of the Lord.»
"And it came about that when I had returned to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the Temple, I was in a semiconscious state,
and saw him saying to me, «Go fast and get out of Jerusalem quickly, for they will not accept your testimony about me.»
"I said, «Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat up in every synagogue every one of them who believed in you,
and the blood of your martyr Stephen was shed, I was standing alongside also, consenting for his death, and kept the clothes of those who killed him.»
"He said to me, «Get out of here, for I will send you far away to the Gentiles.»
They paid attention to him until he said this word, then raised their voices and said, "Away with such a [person] from the earth, for it is not fit for him to live."
As they shouted, throwing their cloaks up, and throwing dust into the air,
the chief captain commanded that he be brought into the barracks and said that he should be examined by flogging so that he might know why they shouted at him like this.
As they were tying him up with leather straps, Paul said to the centurion that stood there, "Is it lawful for you to flog a Roman and uncondemned even?"
When the centurion heard this, he went and told the chief captain saying, "Be careful what you do, for this man is a Roman."
Then the chief captain came and said to him, "Tell me. Are you a Roman?" He said, "Yes."
The chief captain replied, "I obtained this freedom by paying a lot of money." Paul said, "But I was freeborn."
Then they immediately left him alone who was to be examined, and the chief captain also was afraid, after he found out that he was a Roman and because he had tied him up.

Because he wanted to know for certain what he was accused of by the Jews, he loosened him from his shackles and ordered the chief priests and the whole council to come [before him], then he brought Paul down and set him before them.
